name: Right Round
description:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

IMPORTANT

There's a bug when you reach a certain part of the game

where you'll get stuck in pause-time if you die. Sorry :<
To skip it, you've got to either be really lucky, wait an infinite amount of time, or go right when you reach the part in blue
Luckily, it's near the end of the game, so don't worry, you got 99% of the intended experience!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A game I made for the GMTK 2018 Jam. It's a platformer, but you rotate the whole map to move. Hence the name, "Right Round".
Like, you know. The song.  But, the good one.

Kinda sad that the idea wasn't as original as I thought, but I had fun making it so meh
whatever

You can expect minimalism, dogs, red spinny things and a world that kinda looks like a weird platforming version of Plato's Cave.

All I know is that to me, this game looks like (maybe?) lots of fun. So open up your loving hard drive and watch out, here it comes!

Credits

-Tileset: https://opengameart.org/content/minimal-industrial-tiles
-Background: https://opengameart.org/content/ruined-city-background
-Sounds: http://www.orangefreesounds.com/woof-sound-effect/ http://www.orangefreesounds.com/shepard-tone/
-dog: google (literally, just look up "dog")
-font: i got it from a pokémon fangame, sorry

Controls

-Space/Esc pause time
-Left/Right arrows let you rotate the world around you, but only while time is paused
-Pausing time resets your momentum
